predicate.note: Frames file for 'consist' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'exist'. This is really a preposition back-formed into a verb, in my opinion.

example.name: prepositional
example.text: The second part, consisting of $100 million of senior subordinated floating-rate notes, was priced at 99 3/4 to float 4.25% above the three-month London interbank offered rate.
example.arg: $100 million of senior subordinated floating-rate notes

example.name: verbal
example.text: The collateral consists of collateralized whole loans with a weighted average coupon rate of 11.08% and weighted average remaining term to maturity of 28 years.
example.arg: collateralized whole loans with a weighted average coupon rate of 11.08% and weighted average remaining term to maturity of 28 years
